alert.note: Alert for Logan; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:58PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wallace and northwestern Logan Counties through 545 PM MDT/645 PM CDT/... At 457 PM MDT/557 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of Wallace, or 13 miles east of Sharon Springs, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Wallace and northwestern Logan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
